import ChartTypeCard from "./_components/ChartTypeCard.astro";

<AlphaWarning />

## Comparisons among items

These chart types are used to compare values across different categories.

<Grid2Cols>
  <ChartTypeCard imageSrc="./_images/bar-chart.png" title="Bar chart (vertical)" description="Compare the values of different categories. Appropriate for chronological categories." path="/guidelines/data-visualisation/chart-types/bar-chart/" />
  <ChartTypeCard imageSrc="./_images/bar-chart-horizontal.png" title="Bar chart (horizontal)" description="Compare the values of different categories. Appropriate for many categories / long category names." path="/guidelines/data-visualisation/chart-types/bar-chart#horizontal-bar-charts/" />
  <ChartTypeCard imageSrc="./_images/clustered-bar-chart.png" title="Clustered bar chart" description="Compare values of multiple category groups." path="/guidelines/data-visualisation/chart-types/clustered-bar-chart/" />
  <ChartTypeCard imageSrc="./_images/bullet-chart.png" title="Bullet chart" description="Shows how a metric compares with a set goal." path="/guidelines/data-visualisation/chart-types/bullet-chart/" />
</Grid2Cols>

## Comparisons over time

These chart types are used to compare changes over time.

<Grid2Cols>
  <ChartTypeCard imageSrc="./_images/line-chart.png" title="Line chart" description="Shows one or more metrics over a period of time." path="/guidelines/data-visualisation/chart-types/line-chart/" />
  <ChartTypeCard imageSrc="./_images/area-chart.png" title="Area chart" description="Similar to a line chart, but here the area represents the total volume over time." path="/guidelines/data-visualisation/chart-types/line-chart/" path="/guidelines/data-visualisation/chart-types/line-chart/" />
</Grid2Cols>

## Composition

These chart types are used to show part-to-whole relationships.

<Grid2Cols>
  <ChartTypeCard imageSrc="./_images/stacked-bar-chart.png" title="Stacked bar chart" description="Shows how values of a different categories compare to one another." path="/guidelines/data-visualisation/chart-types/stacked-bar-chart/" />
  <ChartTypeCard imageSrc="./_images/stacked-area-chart.png" title="Stacked area chart" description="Shows part-to-whole relationships over time." path="/guidelines/data-visualisation/chart-types/stacked-area-chart/" />
  <ChartTypeCard imageSrc="./_images/pie-donut-chart.png" title="Pie/donut chart" description="Shows a total divided into categories by percentage." path="/guidelines/data-visualisation/chart-types/pie-donut-chart/" />
</Grid2Cols>

## Correlation

These chart types are used to depict the distribution of two or more variables.

<Grid2Cols>
  <ChartTypeCard imageSrc="./_images/scatter-plot.png" title="Scatter plot" description="Shows how the individual data points of two variables correlate." path="/guidelines/data-visualisation/chart-types/scatter-bubble-chart/" />
  <ChartTypeCard imageSrc="./_images/bubble-chart.png" title="Bubble chart" description="Shows how three variables correlate." path="/guidelines/data-visualisation/chart-types/scatter-bubble-chart/#bubble-chart" />
</Grid2Cols>

## Performance

These chart types are used to show how metrics are performing.

<Grid2Cols>
  <ChartTypeCard imageSrc="./_images/big-number-chart.png" title="Big number chart" description="Highlights a metric which is of particular interest." path="/guidelines/data-visualisation/chart-types/big-number-chart/" />
  <ChartTypeCard imageSrc="./_images/meter.png" title="Meter" description="Measures performance on a scale with a set target." path="/guidelines/data-visualisation/chart-types/meter-chart/" />
</Grid2Cols>
